intro: Blastus stellulatus, commonly known as the star-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense, star-like pattern, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. Blastus stellulatus is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
